page.title: 08LEA & GARSDON SCHOOL PRESENT
page.content: The hall, staffroom and kitchen are the original building, and in 1976 they were modernized and two double classrooms were added. The hall which used to be the whole school, is big and tall and needs a lot of heating. The new classrooms are low, need less heating and have nice views over the fields, but we need the lights on a lot. Each double classroom has a seperate library area with sliding doors and two carpeted areas which can be curtained off. They are heated by electric fans which suck in the cold air and blow out hot air. The new building is of bradstone, to blend with the original part built in Cotswold stone. There is a large playing field with climbing frames, hard netball court and seperate infants' playground.
